metadata.title: CVE-2018-7638 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in CImg v.220. A heap-based buffer over-read inload_bmp in CImg.h occurs when loading a crafted bmp image, a differentvulnerability than CVE-2018-7588. This is in a "256 colors" case, aka case8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7638` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cimg-examples - 2.4.5+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cimg package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.5+dfsg-1').
